Reviews.Title: “LOCATION GOOD...PRICE TOO HIGH!”
Reviews.Author: HELGA428
Reviews.Content: First time in Ocean City MD but wished I would have decided to pay a few more dollars, at least I would have gotten more for my money. The room was right across from property light and blinds and all it still shined into my room! Window above AC has no curtain and my luck, also a property light across there which shined into my room too! Kept bathroom door closed because another window that allowed light in as well! Pillows too flat! No sports or local channels on Flatscreen tv. Had to pay 25 cents everytime I needed ice for my drink, yes there was a small refrigerator but really? Every room was booked and you must charge for ice?! Coffee in lobby at all times, ok at least that was free. Free Wi-Fi ! Small pool. Staff was very friendly. 5 minutes to boardwalk...fabulous!! 7 Eleven around the corner from hotel...awesome! Dont look for breakfast..no one offers it even though the signs are on their windows! Really?! Thank You 7 Eleven for coming to the rescue!

Reviews.Title: “Really good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: berwickgal
Reviews.Content: After having an awful night at our first hotel, we checked into the Madison for the remainder of our vacation, and luckily, this motel was great! The rooms aren't huge, but they were big enough for what we needed - a place to sleep, change clothes, and spend an hour out of the sun - and very comfortable! They were very clean, and the bathrooms were well kept. Housekeeping was very friendly, as were all the staff we dealt with, which always makes you feel better. The location is very convenient, close to a 7-11, and right across the street from the busy part of the Boardwalk. Free Wi-Fi is handy, we did find that it came in best when we were sitting outside our rooms, but you don't mind it too much when it's so nice outside. Overall, for the price, this place is great, perfect for a family vacation. I would definitely consider another stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gail M
Reviews.Content: Needed room for three adults, three double beds was great. Small room, shower not very comfortable (way too small), good to have refrigerator and microwave, proximity to beach and boardwalk is great. Coffee available in lobby 24 hours, but might have been nicer to have a coffee pot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms had nothing to them!”
Reviews.Author: KaitlinByrnes
Reviews.Content: First thing id like to say is OMG! My bathroom at home is bigger than this entire room! Wish we would have looked online at reviews and photos before selecting this. Don't get me wrong, we didn't spend a huge amount of time in our room, but when we did, the four of us that stayed here were falling all over one another. No room for luggage. No where to hang wet bathing suits or towels unless you used the railing out side. Lack of mirrors was a big deal. No phone to call the office. Towels seemed like they were really old. Paper thin. Same with the pillows. I don't think they use fabric softner for any of the linens. Lack of pillows was an issue. Tv was nice but we only got a few channels. We were never given the wifi password. Good thing I had 3G on my phone. Pros were the location and the friendliness of the ladies in the office. Housekeeping wasn't always friendly but we barely seen them so it wasn't a huge deal. We spent $320 for two nights. I expected something a lot bigger. Pool was very convenient for the days that we didn't feel like having sand in our bathing suits.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Hudon
Reviews.Content: Room very small. On a rainy day, don't even think about the possibility of staying in the room. Pool very small. If a couple of customer uses it, you cannot enjoy the pool. The motel needs to be refresh. It doesn't look very nice when we get there (and they say that it has been improved!) No phone in the room and no access to a phone. No place to hang our wet clothes or towel after a day at the beach, unless you have a room on the second floor, which is what you want to do if you decide to go there. AC is very loud, you are in between 2 very busy roads, and you can hear people from the other rooms IF they are louder than usual (People having a little too much to drink). Internet was not working in our room. So much for free Wi Fi ! Good side: Very close to the beach and the Pier, where all the action is. The staff was very nice. The room was clean. There is a 7/11 right on the other side of the motel. You go there because it is one of the cheapest place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: CarolinePa
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be pretty simple, I don't need the bells and whistles and I'll gladly give them up for a better price. However, next time I will definitely spend a little extra money for somewhere better. The location of this hotel is great (right on 1st st just a few minute walk to the beach and boardwalk), but that's where the perks stop. The rooms are small, and lack a clean and updated feeling. Although I read that the hotel was rennovated in recent years, it is still very dated. The room we had had 3 painted paneled walls and a conrete block wall. The bathroom was somewhat clean but was old and could use a deep cleaning. The shower is very tiny, the shower head is some odd contraption that sprays water everywehere. The sink was super low with an awkward metal tray above. There is only ONE mirror in the entire room (which is in the very small, very hot and steamy bathroom). We had mildew and mold on our air conditioner which was disgusting. The beds were okay, some stains on the boxspring, I didn't dare to really look hard. There is no clock in the room, but there is a flat screen tv (with about 5 useful channels), a nice mini fridge and microwave. Attempting to get around the room, to find places for luggage, and a place to hang wet clothes and towels is near impossible. The pool had a green tint to it and was not inviting. We were politely informed that housekeeping comes at 9am...insinuating that we should be out of the room or prepared etc. Although we were early risers, that felt extremely rude that housekeeping was just "coming" at 9 in the MORNING!? There is an ice machine, which you have to pay 25 cents for each small bucket of ice. We had housekeeping come in the room once (because we were trying to get ready the first time and just asked for towels) however, all she did was drop off towels, pick up the dirty towels, and change the trash; our beds were still unmade and nothing else was cleaned. I really am not a complainer, but this place was ridiculous. The price and location were two pluses but I would definitely never stay here again. There was a nice Sleep Inn and Suites beside it that I might try...or anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: ami n
Reviews.Content: first off the room is so small for the amount of money you are spending there.we could of gotten an ocean view for a little bit more.the shower is little,there are no mirrors in the room either.the housekeeping staff seems to assume they can come in any time with out knocking.one morning at 11am a little boy around 9 yrs old just busts thru the room as im changing.no knock or anything! i complain to the staff and they tell me hes in training and went in the wrong room.... he was literally no older then 9.then one evening me,my husband and two of our friends head back to the room to drop off our leftover food a security guy comes to the door 30 secs later to tell us we are being too noisy.we just walked in the room! for 8 years me and my husband have been going to ocean city and this time decided to try a new hotel.wrong decision.good luck if you already booked it!next time we will put up the little bit of extra money to stay somewhere nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Do not book! I repeat do not book this hotel is SUCKED!”
Reviews.Author: Maddie J
Reviews.Content: If I could review this motel as 0 I would! When we got there the customer service was horrible. We got to the room and they didn't even have a telephone?!?!? Thats CRAZY! The sheets were stained, the shower was dirty, and there was a cockroach on the ground when we entered. We split the deposit between my friend and I and it has been three weeks (since 4th of July) and I STILL haven't received my security deposit back that was supposedly already given to me. I HATED THIS PLACE! I wish I could have gotten a refund! I WOULD NEVER COME BACK! I THE MADISON BEACH MOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, small, but really clean with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: chlorine_kelsey
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here on a weekend trip to Ocean City during the off-season. We got an amazing deal on the room. It was smaller than we were expecting, but it's a hotel room- you just need a place to sleep, to change, and to use the toilet! It was REALLY clean, which is a must for me. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They told us about things to do our first night when the weather was not cooperating, including fun restaurants. Overall, if you want a five-star hotel, this isn't it. If you want something that's clean, comfortable, and a great deal, then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: flmngo51
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of staying at the Madison Beach Motel for the Springfest. I loved my room, it was clean, the shower had plenty of hot water and a great water flow, even the mattress was comfortable. The pool was closed, it was too early in the season, but they had a great deck for sunning. The location was ideal, convenient to everything. Plenty of parking in their lot. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I just had no complaints, and will use the Madison as my future stays in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Vicki C
Reviews.Content: Well I can start out by saying..no bathtub..ugghhh. For me that was the worst part, but there was also no phone...there was a phonebook though....and you could hear everything through the walls, obviously no insulation..Impossible to sleep. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed!”
Reviews.Author: pbuas
Reviews.Content: the madison beach hotel offered a great way for me to maximize my vacation. Their location to the boardwalk was ideal and their staff was readily avaliable. The madison has clearly been renevated and it has showed off. Their pool was nice for a day when I didnt want to go to the beach and they even had a place to park my extra car! Great visit. great weekend. enough said.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay for the most part. The only bad part is that it rained all day off and on our first night, and the room had tile so it was really slick when it got wet. We also had small kids and it would have been better if there was a bathtub and not just a shower. For the price this is a great place to stay and it is close to the beach. We plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ChrsnAsh
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel online, and was really worried because it had mixed reviews. It was not bad at all! It is a motel, which I've never stayed in, so it is smaller than I'm used to. We stayed in room 212 and it only has a shower, so if you have smaller kids it may not be for you. For us, it was exactly what we needed. Very clean, quiet and a nice flat screen TV to watch while getting ready :) The location is perfect! It's perfectly located one block from the beach, and after you check out from the hotel they allow you to stay parked in their lot until 3pm that day! I must say I was pleased with this hotel. I wanted to stay the next night, but the prices climbed up by over $100 for the weekend. Couldn't afford that, so we didn't stay.

Reviews.Title: “We are coming back next year”
Reviews.Author: mstimeling
Reviews.Content: We liked our single room very much. It was perfect for the two of us. The people that stayed around us were nice. Not to mention it was less than a five minute to walk to the beach. For the price it was great. The folks that run the Madison were very friendly and helpful, especially Nakita the very nice woman who worked the front desk during our stay the first week of August. The freindly cleaning crew kept the room clean and fresh linens daily. Thanks to the entire staff of the Madison for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location”
Reviews.Author: As1225
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at higher priced hotels but due to financial meltdowns with the economy we decided to find one of the cheapest places we could. I was afraid of what we'd find here because Of some of the reviews but I have to say we were quite pleased. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff at the front desk. They made us feel very welcome. Yes, the rooms are very small but they were completely redone and very clean. The location was the best asset of this place. I took my teenage daughter and her friend and all they had to do was cross one street and were right on the boardwalk very close to the rides and games. Very safe and the other guests were so friendly. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: nonono69
Reviews.Content: I booked a room and they charge you in advance. I was not told of this and it is not specified in the web page. The guy I spoke to on the phone was very rude and has no customer service skills. I will never come to this hotel. Oh yea, they even charge you to cancel your room. Even when there website says free cancellation and they still want to charge you. Ridicolus.

Reviews.Title: “beaching”
Reviews.Author: idrissa2
Reviews.Content: we had the most marvelous time in Ocean City recently, and our lodging accomadations were simply wonderful.We stayed at the Madisen Beacgh motel right on Baltimore Ave. it is spectactular,completely renovated with 32' flat screens, all new bedding ,and the staff,from front desk ro housekeeping was amazing,i'd highly recommend the madisen to any and every one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible horrible motel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruhl1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. Horrible hotel! Paper thin walls. The bathroom was dirty and the dirt that was on the floor when we checked in was still there 2 days later when we checked out. A dead bug damaged my someone prior to us stayed smashed on the wall...never cleaned. On the last day the water didnt work. Someone came and said it was fixed but it wasn't. Couldn't shower. Paid over $200 a night for a horrible stay. When I complained, no compensation was offered..nothing. A horrible hotel...don't stay here! I will never again and will make sure everyone I know doesn't as well. Hey mgmt...you had the opportunity to make it right and you chose not to.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: M3LB3LL
Reviews.Content: Motel is in a GREAT spot right next to the boardwalk sign and right around the corner from 7-11. The staff were very nice everytime I had a question and were very nice to my children as well. The room was not dirty. The room rates were very reasonable too. Only thing I would change is there is no carpet in the room, so your feet get really sandy. Overall I woluld highly recommend this hotel for family or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for me to go to the beach with my family”
Reviews.Author: pbuas
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to the beach as a spur of the moment thing with my family for my sons 10th birthday. We did not have a reservation but we figured we would just wing it. The madison was the first place in town that we saw. We decided to stop by and found that the staff was extremely friendly. The trip couldnt have worked out any better. My family and I all had a great time at the madison.

Reviews.Title: “Great value right downtown”
Reviews.Author: OnePATraveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted a good deal on a place near the boardwalk and downtown amenities, and we got it. The Madison Beach staff was great, and we were a short walk from the beach, restaurants, and anything else we needed. Great place for a weekend getaway

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mbrown602
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Madison Beach for a few days the week of Aug. 8. I had read other reviews on Tripadvisor, and expected the rooms to be no frills, budget rooms. However, my one doubled bed room was even smaller than expected. My husband and I shared a double bed that had a plastic mattress cover. We had our 6-month-old daughter with us, and her pack and play took up most of the floor space. It made for a claustrophobic situation. Other than that, the location was very good. We were close to the boardwalk and beach. The maids and front desk staff were very nice. We had plenty of towels. This motel fit our basic needs, but it's probably better suited to young couples on a budget who will spend most of their vacation on the run and less time hanging in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay than here!!”
Reviews.Author: postie94
Reviews.Content: I traveled there in june of 09 and when i walked into the place i almost fell over... they didnt even have the air turned on and it was 90 degrees out... turns out that they barely worked even when we did turn it on. Bathrooms are very old and small and the new Sleep Inn right next door was being built so we heard all the construction in the mornings. Discourteous staff and the tiles were falling into the pool as we were in it. Stayed at the sleep in next door in July 2010... MUCH better value, brand new, and a complimentary breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “RENTER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: jwhite1998
Reviews.Content: It was a long shot, but I thought we found a nice place to stay that wanted to make sure its rooms were filled on the July 4 weekend. As it turned out, they were willing to tell you whatever you wanted to hear to get you down there and take your money. It all started on a Friday evening. I started calling around knowing most places require a 3 night minimum but wanting to come down after the kids' Saturday morning sports. Both the male and female voices on the phone enthusiastically said yes, they would rent my family a room for Saturday and Sunday nights, check out on Monday. Since we were within the 7-day window, if we changed our minds, we would be accountable for the first night's rent ($219). OK, I could handle that, so I booked the room. On the way down, my wife found out some friends were staying in nearby Bethany. Thinking we were only on the hook for $219 (the first night's rent), I said "let's tell the staff at the motel when we arrive that we want to check out early, so they can rent the room for Sunday and/or Monday. WRONG. When we arrive and say our plans have changed and we will be checking out on Sunday, the guy at the front desk ... the professional one with the spacers creating holes in both ears, the pierced tongue, and other piercings below his bottom lip ... tells us that we are on the hook for $438 (both nights) if we check in and/or the $219 (first night) if we do not check in. Hmmm, didn't see that one coming. He and the woman at the front desk then tell us that they have a 2-night minimum. Well, I wasn't told that little detail on the phone and since I asked on the phone before we came down what we were accountable for and was told the deposit of $219, I feel I was lied to or staff neglected to tell me about the $219/$438, damned if you do/damned if you don't, catch-22. Don't make this same mistake. I have been going to OC for more than 30 years and never encountered these shenanigans. There are far too many nicer places to stay than to make this mistake twice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SarahE2010
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for Memorial Day weekend 2010. The rooms were "renovated" well and we were overall satisfied. The rate was awesome at a little over $100/night. The location was great as well, a short walk to the boardwalk and beach, and a great 7-eleven next door for morning coffee. The bathroom is small but you manage. We got a one bed room, we ended up taking our own blow up mattress with our own sheets. (we usually do this when we stay outside our house, its more comfortable, and we feel more clean) Yes, this is a motel that you need to wear flip-tops in, the floor is damp because of the location. We didnt have many complaints. One small thing is the noise. Since it is right off the main turn into OC, the motorcycles and cars can get loud, so kids may not do well there. ***The front desk staff was wonderful and soo helpful***

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!”
Reviews.Author: stellar69405
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night last year after deciding to stay an extra night with friends (stayed at the Haven Hotel for 3 nights prior). when we arrived we found the girl at the front desk to be sort of rude. she gave us our keys and we headed out to find our room (she never told us where it was, and the motel has 3 or 4 buildings). Finally found it next to the pool... and in front of one of the biggest cranes i've ever seen. we climbed the 3 flights of stairs up to our room.. opened the door... and were HORRIFIED. the room was about the size of a closet. the smell was terrible. only one bed had a headboard, the other had glue on the wall from where one MAY have been at one time. the only light in the room was covered with a lampshade that had SOMEHOW escaped fire, as it was clearly scorched. the beds were very uncomfortable and were covered with plastic sheets, which didnt make for easy sleeping. the bathroom is a WHOLE different paragraph. the shower was a hole in the wall... literally. i'm only 100lbs and i couldnt even fit in there, let alone my boyfriend and 2 other female friends. the window wouldnt open. i dont even think you could close the door and sit on the toilet. and then there were the neighbors. as my friends and i were sitting outside (because theres no way all of us could be in the room at the same time), and we noticed our neighbors coming in and out of their room quite often, checking windows, just being generally shady. all of a sudden a little girl, maybe 3 or 4 years old, was SHOVED out of the room and made to sit on the 'balcony' alone to eat her cereal. my friends and i were shocked. after about 5 minutes the door opened briefly (checking on her perhaps?) and then closed again... followed by a HEAVY smell of marijuana. this happened a few times until the little girl continued to knock on the door until they let her in. The smell continued all night. i would like to state that i am 23 years old and have stayed at my fair share of 1 star hotels, but i wouldnt EVER consider staying here again... even if it were free. granted i only had access to 1 room, that room made a LASTING impression. i would like to suggest the Rivera on 26th for younger crowds and the Executive Motel on 30th and Baltimore for vacationers of any age. The Haven Hotel on 1st and Boardwalk is also very nice. I will be posting reviews for each as i am able.

Reviews.Title: “A Horror”
Reviews.Author: MManis426
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is very close to the boardwalk and the staff is lovely and very accomodating, the rooms are dingy, run-down and they smell. We had to run the air conditioner constantly (in October) so that we wouldn't smell the odor. There is mold on the shower curtains (which blow in and stick to you when you're showering) and in the showers. The carpets feel absolutely filthy - don't step on them without shoes on. A light fixture fell on my friend's head in the bathroom. It is a "good" price but you're better off spending a little more and getting something decent.

Reviews.Title: “So little for so much...”
Reviews.Author: Youngtegger
Reviews.Content: When my group decided to take off and go to the beach a few days we were limited to what was availible. Upon contacting this motel the gentlemen that answered was very helpful and willing to even negioate the rates. Whenever a motel negioates a rate, chances are there are reasons for that. Once we arrived the woman at the front desk tried to tell us we did not have reservations and that they didn't have any vacancies. After an 8 hour car ride the fear of god was in my eyes, and she eventually found our reservations. We paid $5 for each key we needed, along with that we found out you have to pay for ice? The room itself is pretty gross, the bed sheets looked like they were never laundered and the mattress was beyond "firm". I also did find upon entering the room, a small army of bugs on the floor. The shower stall was hands down one of the most gruesome sights! I barely could fit in the shower, it was such a joke. I will say one thing, the air conditoning worked well and the tv made it a little better. If you can afford to shell out some more money you'd be better off with some of the more well-known places. They even put a tip request in the room for cleaning, uh please it was never clean in the first place and we didn't even get clean towels---not that we wanted their nasty towels.

Reviews.Title: “nice for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: w426782
Reviews.Content: the rooms were small but served their purpose to sleep in however if someone ended up sick i would not want to spend all day in the room. the rooms were not spotless but not filthy either they were just ok. the bathrooms were very very small the shower was VERY small no bathtub which i wasn't to thrilled about because i have two small kids that prefer bathing . the rooms also have no phone in them. you also have to pay to use the ice machine which i thought was a little crazy on the plus side it is very close to the boardwalk, beach, and amusement rides. the pool was nice but also small and very rough inside myself and both my children scaped our leg on the pool bad enough to bring blood so be careful of the sides and bottom of pool not a smooth surface.
